attributes.action: Parliament to amend the law, requiring all councils to provide textile recycling
attributes.background:
Textile recycling should be introduced as mandatory into every single home in the U.K. 
There should also be a module introduced into schools on the importance of recycling & social responsibility. Communicating the textile recycling message to both homedwellers and dependants educated in the U.K.
attributes.additional_details:
The U.K clothing sector is responsible for more than 3m tonnes of co2 emissions.
consuming 2.16m tonnes of clothing and textiles/year, spending approx £38.4bn on clothing alone.

Households in the uk send more than 18.8m tonnes of rubbish (1.4m textiles) to landfill every year-2m tonnes more than EU counterparts.

U.K landfill rates are growing faster each year, emitting methane gas and accelerating climate change.

Anyone serious about tackling global warming should support efforts to recycle.

attributes.action: Teach taxes, financial situations, bills, and how to handle money, in schools
attributes.background: This petition is for taxes, bills, loans, mortgages and money/bank situations to be taught in secondary schools, as I have left school myself and starting to deal with financial situations etc. I am oblivious to financial dealings and friends of my age also have no knowledge on money transactions.

attributes.action: Make eateries develop a menu accessible and readable for all
attributes.background: After a recent meal out with people with learning disabilities I found myself wondering why, with all the focus on rights and choice there was no easy read menu. One non-verbal service user had to just eat what was chosen for him, whereas if there were menus with photos he could choose for himself.
attributes.additional_details: It would not take much for restaurants and cafes to develop a photo menu, as well as a menu in braille. There is huge focus on treating people equally in society these days, yet in so many establishments a large amount of the population are ignored. We now have wheelchair access in most places for physically disabled people so it's about time all disabled people were considered.

attributes.action: I propose we have a referendum to change the current immigration rules.
attributes.background:
I would like to prevent the following countries citizens from immigrating to the UK for security concerns.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for parents to stop the other parent seeing their children
attributes.background: Some parents use children as a weapon to hurt the other parent. This is wrong in many ways and needs to stop. Let's get something done about it! Make it illegal for parents to do this without a court order or police recommendation

attributes.action: End the Housing Crisis
attributes.background: We are in a housing crisis and something needs to desperately be done such as these initiatives below;
attributes.additional_details:
Give Bursaries/reduce restrictions on brownfield sites, especially to smaller housing companies; This will allow for more building, with the added benefit of being more sustainable.

That each development must have a specified % of council, affordable,  single-living & various bedroom houses available, so to meet the needs of the whole community.

A law that after a developer has received their planning permission, they have a specified amount of time in which to finish their build.

attributes.action: Stop Corporation tax cuts and put the Money into Social Care.
attributes.background: £4.6 BILLION in corporation tax cuts is currently being planned by the Tory Party.   Yesterday, Wednesday 14th Dec, in the last Prime ministers question time of the year,  Jeremy Corbyn MP appealed for the £4.6b in corporation tax cuts be put into Social care instead to help solve this crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
The Tory government has cut Social Care and the PM, cabinet, and everybody else knows the effects of these cuts.This crisis is a difficult one for many elderly people because it is also a crisis for the NHS. Those people who are in hospital cannot be discharged because there is nowhere else for them to go. The crisis affects individuals, families and The NHS. 

References
https://youtu.be/p_gl4Z-PJTk

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/m.huffpost.com/uk/entry/uk_585149c8e4b08b39538f4bf0/amp

https://www.politicshome.com/news/uk/politics/news/81735/live-prime-ministers-questions-141216

attributes.action: A life sentence to mean life imprisonment.
attributes.background: A life sentence handed out to criminals should mean they spend the rest of their life behind bars with no option for early release
attributes.additional_details: All too often we hear of people being sentenced for horrific crimes and murders and are told they've been given a 'life sentence ' of which they must serve a minimum of 4 years or something ridiculous like that. Life should mean life, to combat the response of "we don't have the money or the space" - in these cases bring back the death penalty for murderers and child abusers who show no remorse and stop imprisoning people for petty offences like 'possession of cannabis'

attributes.action: Ban Strobe Lighting at Events like concerts etc
attributes.background: In the UK 1 in 103 people suffer from a form of epilepsy. Epileptics should be able to enjoy live music, films, shows, clubs etc. I am not asking for the occasional strobe to be banned but I am asking that excessive strobe lighting be banned.

attributes.action: Move council tax non-payment months to Dec & Jan to help with winter fuel costs
attributes.background: On a 10 month direct debit plan, council tax isn't paid in April or May, please just change that to December and January to give everyone more money during the cold winter months to help with fuel costs and Christmas expenses.
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government can make all councils do this by amending the Council Tax (Administration and Enforcement) Regulations 1992.

attributes.action: Legalize the medicinal use and sale of Cannabis via prescription.
attributes.background:
Millions of people throughout the world and in the UK suffer from conditions of which Cannabis offers a significant and harmless relief. 
To name a few:
-Glaucoma
-Seizures (Dravet's syndrome)
-Alzheimer's Disease
-Multiple Sclerosis
-Arthritis
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.who.int/medicines/access/controlled-substances/6_2_cannabis_update.pdf

http://www.encod.org/info/700-MEDICINAL-USES-OF-CANNABIS.html

attributes.action: Dedicate July 1st as a bank holiday in memory of princess Diana.
attributes.background: Princess Diana was a prominent member of British history and deserves to be remembered for her contributions to her charity work and her support of the International Campaign to ban landmines. This bank holiday could replace the Whitsun bank holiday.
attributes.additional_details: The Whitsun bank holiday has become outdated and lost its meaning to the general public. We propose that the Princess Diana bank holiday would be more suitable, as it's closer to the nations heart. Her continued support for Great Ormand Street and other charities has allowed her to become an iconic role model for younger generations to aspire to be like. July 1st marks her birthday and a bank holiday on this day would allow the British public to remember and celebrate her and her achievements.

attributes.action: Scrap the Severn bridge tolls!
attributes.background:
Their is no need for the Severn bridge to have tolls! It is proven that they don't need it anymore. It makes 90 million and the mantence costs are 15 million...so where's the rest of the money going?! 

You don't pay to go to Scotland....so why do we have to pay to go to Wales.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2015 overall revenue from the tolls was over £90m, while it had been suggested that maintenance costs amounted to between £13m and £15m.

It would be a major boost for the Welsh ecomony, but it is getting held back from getting that vital boost.

attributes.action: Create an age and licence type restriction for drivers of more powerful cars
attributes.background: Young bikers are restricted as to how powerful a bike they can ride based on their age & licence type, yet car drivers can drive any car at any age once they've passed a manual test. This leaves fast cars in the hands of people who aren't competent to drive them, and is also unfair to bikers.
attributes.additional_details: Government statistics from 2011 show that 22% of road fatalities in that year involved drivers aged 17-24. A motorcycle-style age and licence grading system needs to be enforced to reduce these figures.

attributes.action: Require the Cabinet ministers to have experience relevant to their roles.
attributes.background: In most public sector jobs the relevant Cabinet minister has little/no experience actually doing any of the jobs they oversee. It would give them more credibility if they have done the jobs in the sector that they're responsible for. eg.The minister for health should have worked in healthcare.

attributes.action: Stop all ivory trade from the UK and press for bans globally
attributes.background: Ivory collected after 1947 is currently illegal globally, however, Britain still exports legal Ivory to many countries such as Hong Kong, this  contributes greatly to the Ivory trade and can help salesmen conceal their illegal imports from across Africa, drastically harming elephant populations.

attributes.action: Make it law that qualified electricians are allowed to break seals on cutouts
attributes.background: It is time that us electricians of which are highly trained and aware of electricity at work act do our jobs.
attributes.additional_details: Jobs can become more expensive and time consuming relying on an already over stretched national grid.  Just as BT had to open openreach allow electricians the right for basic electrical connections and force national grid to sell new seals.

attributes.action: Find accommodation for all unaccompanied children stranded in  Calais Jungle
attributes.background:
1500 children stranded in containers and tents around the area known as the Jungle in Calais urgently need appropriate housing 
& support,
 To leave unaccompanied minors who have been left to fend for themselves  is immoral, unsafe and reckless.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/the-calais-jungle-has-become-like-lord-of-the-flies-with-1500-children-left-behind-in-containers-and-a7388021.html

attributes.action: Reinstate George Osborne's plan to set up a 2nd hand annuity market
attributes.background: People have been waiting nearly two years to be able to sell their poor monthly payments for cash lump sums where they can make a difference to their lives.   For example, I've sat with no working boiler as I can't afford one without my annuity funds in one payment.

attributes.action: That the Government delay triggering Article 50 until 23rd June, 2031.
attributes.background: That the Government delay triggering Article 50 of the Treaty on European Union until 23rd June, 2031, that is a period of 15 years from the referendum date. This delay is to enable the economy to stabilise and allow proper preparations to be put in place for the separation from the European Union.

attributes.action: make abortion illegal in the uk unless raped or health risks to mum or baby
attributes.background: make abortion illegal in the united kingdom unless pregnant by rape or there is health risks to the mum and/or baby

attributes.action: Move the Ministry for Exiting the EU to Northern England
attributes.background: It is important that the ministry has a good appreciation of the needs of the economy outside the S.E. of England where a great deal of the regeneration and products produced for export come from. It would help in the building confidence in and reinforcing the Northern Powerhouse.
attributes.additional_details: The re-balancing of the economy will be an important component of restructuring the economy after Brexit, the industrial areas of the north had traditionally been part of the successful rise of Britain as a global superpower.

attributes.action: Let the victims decide who should next head the Westminster abuse.inquiry.
attributes.background: Someone who is trusted or members of the public should put forward respectable candidates from which the victims should choose the head of the inquiry. The main qualification required by potential candidates is integrity.
attributes.additional_details: WE MUST HAVE ANSWERS

attributes.action: No confidence vote in Amber Rudd for denying visa to bone marrow donor.
attributes.background: May Brown, 23, from Dorset, who has leukaemia, has been told that her Nigerian sister Martha is a "10 out of 10" tissue match.  However, the Home Office denied a visa because "all visa applications must be assessed against the immigration rules".
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-dorset-37656377

attributes.action: Present a draft UN resolution that would implement a no fly zone over Syria.
attributes.background: UK to call on all civilised nations of the world (via the United Nations) to draft a UN resolution that would implement a no fly zone over Syria and would apply to ALL aircraft of Syria, Russia, and lran for the purposes of military operations until the complete and total cessation of hostilities.
attributes.additional_details:
Over 3000,000 people have now lost their lives in this conflict. The UN has officially declared Aleppo as besieged. Russian and Syrian forces and their allies must not be allowed to continue to flout international law and bomb civilians, civilian infrastructure, hospitals and aid operations. Since the breakdown of the recent cease-fire on September 19 over 500 civilians have been killed in Aleppo alone, with at least 100 of those being children.
Sources: 
www.unicef.org
www.syriahr.com
and more

attributes.action: The Royal Marines Calendar should be allowed
attributes.background: Allow the Royal Marines to release thier annual calendar to raise money for essential charities. If the government cannot fund the charities the Royal Marines want to support, then allow them to raise the money by making a calendar!

attributes.action:
Petition
Allow farmers to grow hemp without restriction.
attributes.background: Remove all restrictions on growing industrial hemp. Although the industrial strains of the plant have no psychoactive potential, the absurd level of control has effectively destroyed its value as an agricultural crop. The fibres , the oils , plastics- endless possibilities all natural
attributes.additional_details: Bees on the endangered species list - kind of important due to pollination - bees love hemp..

attributes.action: Force the government to raise the threshold of inheritance tax to £1,000,000.
attributes.background: Current threshold for inheritance tax is £325,000. After that a 40% rate is applied.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.ons.gov.uk/economy/inflationandpriceindices/bulletins/housepriceindex/2015-04-14

https://www.gov.uk/inheritance-tax/overview

attributes.action: Bring back the paper tax disc.
attributes.background: Bring back the paper tax disc, as you can view the tax disc on your screen and can be seen, that you have a tax disc and have the tax, as people are not paying the tax, as well all the tax should go towards the up keep of the road only and not to be used with other tax.
attributes.additional_details: The DVLA hasn't done enough to tell people when they need to pay. When your tax is due, you get a reminder letter, but this is not enough for thousands of people, who forget their renewal date, and can face a fine of up to £1,000.

attributes.action: Ban the use of button batteries in children's toys
attributes.background:
The UK is seeing a large increase in serious injuries, and in some cases death, from children swallowing button batteries. 
At the same time, we are seeing an large increase in the use of button batteries in children's toys. 
Surely this cannot be coincidence?
attributes.additional_details:
Why are we using several button batteries when a single AA or AAA battery would do the same job with a minimal increase in size? 
AA type batteries are much less appetising to toddlers and babies who have managed to open their toys to reveal a potentially fatal prize, as well as being much harder to swallow.
My toddler hasn't been injured, thankfully, but when I started to think about how many of his toys contain 3 or 4 of these batteries each, I became quite concerned.

attributes.action: Raise the fine for using a handheld device at the wheel to £1,000.
attributes.background: The Press states that the fine for using a handheld device at the wheel will be doubled from £100 to £200.   For a car owner / driver this is ridiculously small.   I believe that the Government should raise the fine for such dangerous behaviour to at least £1,000.   Breaking this law should hurt!

attributes.action: Create a specialist police unit to deal with modern day slavery.
attributes.background: Modern day slavery is a big issue in the UK with the amount of people referred to the National Referral Mechanism up. I believe that the UK Government should create a national modern slavery unit to crack down on modern day slave owners and the human traffickers that get them into the country.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government's Modern Slavery Strategy:
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/383764/Modern_Slavery_Strategy_FINAL_DEC2015.pdf

The National Crime Agency's statistics on Slavery:
http://www.nationalcrimeagency.gov.uk/publications/national-referral-mechanism-statistics

attributes.action: DWP: decision to extend the waiting time for Mortgage payment to 39 weeks!
attributes.background:
If you get laid off / paid off / made redundant and have a mortgage – you have to wait 39 Weeks before the DWP will make any payment to your lender? 
This is a disgrace – It used to be 13 Weeks wait before April of this year, which was bad enough, but now 9 Months – how are people meant to survive?
attributes.additional_details:
What are the government thinking abouts? 
Do they want to make people homeless? They would then be responsible for housing them.
There is a severe lack of social housing – and this will just add to the crisis. Social housing will cost 3-4 times the amount of the mortgage!

SMI: Support for Mortgage Interest 
https://www.gov.uk/support-for-mortgage-interest/what-youll-get

attributes.action: Make ASLs (Bicycle boxes) illegal for motor vehicles to stop or rest in.
attributes.background: The Advanced Stop Line (Bicycle box) is consistently and wrongly used by motor vehicles stop in, despite it not being allowed, it's not a fineable offence unless an officer sees one enter it. They are there for cyclists safety and should be treated like yellow box junctions by motor vehicles.

attributes.action: Free prescriptions for stroke survivors
attributes.background: Make prescriptions free of charge on any medication for stroke survivors

attributes.action: Get British troops out of Iraq and Syria and stop all air strikes now
attributes.background: The presence of British troops in Syria and Iraq and the bombing and killing of innocent people including children is beyond wrong this war that's already been shown to be fake, no weapons of mass destruction were ever found so why does it carry on?!
attributes.additional_details: The fight to have Tony Blair held accountable for his actions over the war in Iraq speaks for itself and you only need to watch the news and see poor babies and children being pulled from rubble that was once their local hospital, library, school or home. So many leave their homes and don't ever return it's so wrong and we shouldn't stand by and let it happen any longer, the world will be one by peace love and cooperation not hate fighting and war. We can stop it together

attributes.action: Limit maximum private parking charges.
attributes.background: This petition is to get a law in place to limit the maximum fine private parking companies can charge to £60 and a minimum of a 50% discount if paid within 14 days.

attributes.action: Independent scrutiny into Lancs Teaching Hospitals handling of A&E downgrade
attributes.background: On 13th April 2016, it was announced that A&E department would be downgraded to an Urgent Care Centre. LTH said the A&E department would reopen in August but have now confirmed it will stay closed until a review in April 2017.
attributes.additional_details: There now needs to be an independent oversight and scrutiny of the decisions and actions taken by the CEO and board of Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust. The Health Select Commitee and Department of Health need to intervene in the ongoing situation at Chorley and South Ribble A&E.  It is imperative the management of LTH is held to account for their decisions and actions around the downgrade of the A&E department in April 2016 and subsequent actions taken to reinstate A&E.

attributes.action: Force advertisers to label manipulated images and provide link to original media
attributes.background: Our children and young adults are surrounded by media portraying unnatural and mostly unattainable body images. In many cases that media has been considerably digitally manipulated (eg, airbrushing) and I propose legislation for such images to include a link to the original unenhanced image.
attributes.additional_details: Many studies and reports show the negative effect on our younger generation of being constantly subjected to images of such extreme and artificial body images. By forcing the producers of such media to include a link to the original image (by way of, say, a reference number or QR code or similar) the media would be more transparent to such harmful image manipulation.

attributes.action: home buyer's consumer rights must be protected better with tighter regulations.
attributes.background: The rights of the home buyer must be protected with more stringent regulations.  Consumer rights for home buyers must be implemented and enforced. Legislation must force builders to resolve items (floor area, design etc) prior to sale. stronger regulation must be enforced for after sale responses.
attributes.additional_details: I purchased a new build on help-to-buy from a reputable builder who benefitted (£600 million in bonuses alone) by miss-selling their houses. The floor space of the house is 6.5% less than advertised. The losses are significant based on the correlation of area to price.The NHBC guarantee provided for new homes must protect interests of the home buyer from the builders. This is a failing system. The advertised floor area and design must be proven before the sale with the right to cancellation.

attributes.action: Make the Asylum seeker dispersal scheme mandatory to all councils in the U.K.
attributes.background:
The process in which Asylum seekers are granted housing in the U.K. is dependant on councils that volunteer to be part of the scheme. 
Currently, there is no mandatory requirement for all councils to participate meaning that councils are able to, and do abstain from the effort.
attributes.additional_details:
The humanitarian crisis we are facing should not be left only to those councils most willing, as it creates an unnecessarily large strain on some councils that should be shared. 

At least 38 councils have not signed up to the scheme which includes the rehoming of refugee children who entered the UK alone. 

The current voluntary system is unfair, and means that schools, healthcare resources and other public services in participating councils are needlessly overstretched.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for schools to discriminate uniform between boys and girls
attributes.background: Schools all around the UK make children wear separate uniforms, this causes problems to arise through clashes of opinion in terms of what parents thinks children should wear and what the school demands that they wear. In this world of 'equality' surely we should start at the route of inequality.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to smoke in the uk for everyone born after 2020 Save our kids.
attributes.background:
Cigarette smoking harms nearly every organ of the body, causes many diseases, and reduces the health of smokers in general.1,2
Quitting smoking lowers your risk for smoking-related diseases and can add years to your life.
attributes.additional_details:
Nhs loses tax revenue from lost productivity when people are made ill by smoking. Conditions caused by smoking cost the NHS billions.
The cost of treating smokers in England was estimated at £2.7 billion in 2006. And that was 10 years ago just think how much it costs the NHS now

attributes.action: Allow 16/17 year olds to vote.
attributes.background: In Year 9 in secondary school we are made to choose our GCSE subjects, at 16 we can smoke, win the lottery have sex, get a job. At 17 you can drive and you start choosing your University/life root and yet we cannot vote until we're 18. WE as a generation are one of the most educated ever. FIX IT.

attributes.action: Hold a 2nd referendum which includes 2 million EU Nationals living in Britain.
attributes.background:
Did the EU referendum breach the
CHARTER OF FUNDAMENTAL RIGHTS OF THE EU
CH V: CITIZENS' RIGHTS Article 41
Right to good administration
2.     This right includes:
the right of every person to be heard, before any individual measure which would affect him or her adversely is taken;
attributes.additional_details:
The EU Referendum precluded over 2 million EU Nationals living in Britain from voting, the outcome of which will affect them adversely.
If we leave the EU it is likely EU Nationals will stay in Britain and will then have the right to vote in all elections, with a possibility of a coalition government with the SNP and Liberal Democrats calling for a referendum.
The vote to leave the EU has sent shock waves throughout Europe we have a chance to influence the EU and re-unite Europe.

attributes.action: Populate the Isle of Wight with Deer
attributes.background: Currently there are only a handful of deer on the Isle of Wight due to everytime any are spotted they are exterminated but I think that having deer on the island if controlled satisfactorily would be a good asset for the island.

attributes.action: Deliberate a vote of No Confidence in Jeremy Hunt the Health Secretary.
attributes.background: Following the demise of the NHS through lack of funding please deliberate a vote of No Confidence in Jeremy Hunt the Health Secretary to change the direction of the NHS and protect it for future generation's. Our lives depend on it!

attributes.action: Ban use of satellite navigation visual aids for black cab and private hire trade
attributes.background: Public safety should not be abused by allowing drivers of black cabs and private hire vehicles the elevated chance of being distracted and a danger to person or property whislt operating a vehicle and satellite navigation simultaneously whislt booked. Dont keep loved ones at risk with that booking.
attributes.additional_details: As stated on the gov.uk website under the policy paper regarding improving the driving test updated 25 August 2015, demonstrates there is evidence in the government's view to explore both the correlation between distrations, the causes of accidents and the need to perhaps introduce a baseline standard for drivers to demonstrate the ability to use satellite navigation safely. The general public in the interim of findings should be risk protected. Use of sat nav should be customer opt in only.

attributes.action: Stop the Deportation of Sikhs and Hindus to the Islamic Republic of Afghanistan
attributes.background: While the 2004 constitution of Afghanistan allows for religions other than Islam to freely exercise their faith within the limits of the law in reality Afghan Sikhs and Hindu’s continue to face harassment and violence. on 29/12/2016 an Afghan Sikh head was shot five times, also previously targeted.
attributes.additional_details: As community size shrinks Sikhs&Hindus are finding themselves vulnerable to exploitation against which they have no defence. Dr Guiztozzi states that the reported attacks and harassment amount to a very serious threat thus 99.99% of the Minority group have opted to abandon their property and flee. Therefore, considering the small size (0.01% from 32m people) of the community prevalent & the sample episodes of abuse & harassment indicates high level of pressure on the Sikh and Hindu Community

attributes.action: Remove the unecessary, excessively armed, MoD presence in Scotland
attributes.background: The Rosneath peninsula in Scotland is home to a widely unpopular military installation. The MoD have, with little to no consultation with the local population, increased their presence in the region. This needs to be undone handing back Scottish policing to Police Scotland.
attributes.additional_details: In a move the government has justified with maintaining national security more weapons and officers with more of a will to use them are being placed in rural Scotland. This is supposedly to defend a military installation which many Scots do not want on their land and do not want so dangerously close to their population centres.
